page.title: 05Farming around Kinver
page.content:
Much of the land in this area to the east of Kinver Edge is used as grazing land for sheep at certain times of the year. There are some cattle and pigs. This grazing helps to prepare the land for growing crops at other seasons. Some land remains for grazing all year round particularly that near the five sewage farms in the block.
There is some arable farming. Cereal crops are grown: mainly spring and winter barley. There are also vegetables, particularly potatoes. Sugar beet is grown and this is harvested in late autumn and taken to the processing plant in Kidderminster about six miles away.
The area contains about ten farms in all.
